publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-5912 Rob Gibson: Balblair Distillery Wins Best Highland Malt—That the Parliament congratulates Balblair Distillery, Scotland’s second oldest distillery, in being awarded Best Highland Single Malt Whisky at the 2010 World Whiskies Awards for its Balbair Vintage 1975; understands that this world-recognised distillery in Edderton near Tain releases just 3,000 bottles of the Balblair Vintage 1975 worldwide; praises everyone at Balblair, which is considered by many to have maintained the highest levels of quality since the distillery first opened in 1790; believes that Balblair represents the finest standard of iconic Scottish malt whisky to the world, and wishes all at Balblair the best of luck for the future. Supported by: Jamie McGrigor*, Kenneth Gibson*, Bob Doris*, Stewart Maxwell*, Joe FitzPatrick*, Aileen Campbell*, Jamie Stone*, John Wilson*, Robin Harper*, Bill Kidd*, Sandra White*, Mary Scanlon*
S3M-5912 Balblair Distillery Wins Best Highland Malt (lodged on 9 March 2010) Stuart McMillan*, Gil Paterson*

S3M-5912 Rob Gibson: Balblair Distillery Wins Best Highland Malt—That the Parliament congratulates Balblair Distillery, Scotland’s second oldest distillery, in being awarded Best Highland Single Malt Whisky at the 2010 World Whiskies Awards for its Balbair Vintage 1975; understands that this world-recognised distillery in Edderton near Tain releases just 3,000 bottles of the Balblair Vintage 1975 worldwide; praises everyone at Balblair, which is considered by many to have maintained the highest levels of quality since the distillery first opened in 1790; believes that Balblair represents the finest standard of iconic Scottish malt whisky to the world, and wishes all at Balblair the best of luck for the future. Supported by: Jamie McGrigor, Kenneth Gibson, Bob Doris, Stewart Maxwell, Joe FitzPatrick, Aileen Campbell, Jamie Stone, John Wilson, Robin Harper, Bill Kidd, Sandra White, Mary Scanlon, Stuart McMillan, Gil Paterson, Maureen Watt*, Michael Matheson*
